alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 11:48AM MDT until June 11 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Wednesday afternoon rainfall over the southern Wind River Range has produced rises of a little less than one foot on the Little Popo Agie River from Red Canyon through Lyons Valley. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a combination of rain and snowmelt. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Fremont. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, including in Lyons Valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1140 AM MDT, the Little Popo Agie River near Red Canyon had crested and was slowly falling. Rising water levels in Lyons Valley indicated the crest was just upstream of that location. The crest should move downstream through Lyons Valley between 2 and 5 PM Thursday. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Little Popo Agie River drainage. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lyons Valley.
info.instruction: Do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
